rulings.text: Because combat damage resolves immediately after it is assigned, you cannot sacrifice Blood Pet in between assigning and dealing combat damage. The last chance you have to sacrifice it before combat damage is dealt is during the Declare Blockers step.

mainBoard.name: Giant Spider
mainBoard.originalText: Giant Spider can block as though it had flying.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

mainBoard.text: If Gravebane Zombie would die, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.

mainBoard.name: Hidden Horror
mainBoard.originalText: When Hidden Horror comes into play, choose and discard a creature card from your hand. If you don't, sacrifice Hidden Horror.

rulings.text: If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.
When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can’t perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.

mainBoard.text: When Hidden Horror enters, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

mainBoard.name: Rampant Growth
mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
